class.name: MmasLoggerConfigRoot
class.description: The class MmasLoggerConfigRoot Mo represents the main node for logging configuration in MMAS.

attribute.name: mmasLoggerConfigRootId
attribute.description: This attribute defines the identity of the MmasLoggerConfigRoot instance.

attribute.name: logConfigModelPollInterval
attribute.description: This attribute defines the period between polls of the Mbeans to detect configuration changes. If a logging level is changed then this is the maximum period the operator will have to wait until the change takes effect. - Range 1000 - 3000 milliseconds.

attribute.name: globalLoggerLevel
attribute.description: This attribute defines the level for the Java Logging root logger. If a logger does not have a specific logging level defined for it, and no logger in the naming hierarchy above it provides a specific logging level, then the global-logger-level will be the effective level. - Supported levels are: SEVERE, WARNING, INFO, CONFIG, FINE, FINER, FINEST, ALL.

attribute.name: l4jGlobalLoggerLevel
attribute.description: This attribute defines the level for the Log4J root logger. If a logger does not have a specific logging level defined for it, and no logger in the naming hierarchy above it provides a specific logging level, then the l4jglobal-logger-level will be the effective level. Log4J logging levels are managed in order to provide support for third-party applications that use the Log4J logging package. - Supported levels are: FATAL, ERROR, WARN, INFO, DEBUG, TRACE, ALL.

class.name: MmasPmConfig
class.description: The class MmasPmConfig is the configuration node for the MMAS.

attribute.name: mmasPmConfigId
attribute.description: This attribute defines the identity of the MmasPmConfig instance.

attribute.name: outputPath
attribute.description: This attribute defines the directory where Performance Management (PM) reports are placed.

attribute.name: counterFilePath
attribute.description: This attribute defines the directory from where counter definitions files are loaded by the PM module.

attribute.name: counterFileLoaderInterval
attribute.description: This attribute defines how often counter definitions files are read.

attribute.name: defaultReporter
attribute.description: This attribute defines the class that is acting as the default reporter for all PM jobs which do not define a reporter themselves. Possible values are: "com.ericsson.mmas.pm.report.AggregationReporter" and "com.ericsson.mmas.pm.report.SimpleReporter".

attribute.name: aggregateReporterCollectTimer
attribute.description: This attributes defines the time for the aggregation module to wait for PM reports from the different traffic instances.

attribute.name: statusInspectionPool
attribute.description: This attribute defines the pool holding the threads corresponding to the different status inspections in each instance.

attribute.name: statisticRate
attribute.description: Performance statistic collection rate

class.name: MmasMonitoring
class.description: The class MmasMonitoring is the fault management node for MMAS.

attribute.name: mmasMonitoringId
attribute.description: This attribute defines the identity of the MmasMonitoring instance.

class.name: MmasLogHandlerStreamConfig
class.description: The class MmasLogHandlerStreamConfig Mo is the node for the Audit, Access and Applog streams sonfiguration in MMAS.

attribute.name: mmasLogHandlerStreamConfigId
attribute.description: This attribute defines the identity of the MmasLogHandlerStreamConfig instance.

attribute.name: logHandlerStreamName
attribute.description: This attribute defines the identifier for the logging stream across the Service Availability Forum" (SAF) cluster.

attribute.name: logHandlerLogFilePath
attribute.description: This attribute defines the location of the log file. For log streams this file path is relative to a system file path defined by the Telecommunication Server Platform (TSP) SAF layer. This path can specify any subdirectories relative to the system file path. For the local machine flat file log this is an absolute file path.

attribute.name: logHandlerLogFileName
attribute.description: This attribute defines the prefix for the name of the log file within the directory. Recommended values are: - AuditLog for the audit log stream, - AppLog for the application log stream.

attribute.name: logHandlerMaxFileSize
attribute.description: This attribute defines the maximum size of an individual record in a log stream file. This allows a guaranteed number of log records within a file of a given maximum size.

attribute.name: logHandlerHighAvailabilityFlag
attribute.description: This attribute specifies whether the log stream files are to be replicated and persisted across the cluster, or not. This attribute is represented as an integer, coded as follows: 0=No Persist, 1=Persist.

attribute.name: logHandlerNumRotationFiles
attribute.description: This attribute defines the number of previous versions of log files, when logHandler-actionWhenFull is set to SA_LOG_FILE_FULL_ACTION_ROTATE. - Range 0 to 25.

attribute.name: logHandlerRecordFormat
attribute.description: This attribute defines the format of a log record entry in the log stream file. The format string contains the fields in the order they are required with any separator characters between them. The syntax of the fields in the format string is described in the Service Availability Forum Application Interface Specification for the Log Service (SAI-AIS-LOG).

attribute.name: logHandlerLogLevel
attribute.description: This attribute defines the log level for the log stram files. - Default AUDIT for Audit stream and OFF for AppLog stream.

attribute.name: logHandlerMaxRecordSize
attribute.description: This attribute defines the maximum size of an individual record in a log stream file. This allows a guaranteed number of log records within a file of a given maximum size. - Default for AppLog stream is 3500. - Default for Audit stream is 1024.

attribute.name: logHandlerActionWhenLogFull
attribute.description: This attribute defines the behavior when a log file is full. There are three possible actions when a log file is full: - Stop logging (not recommended) - Wrap the log (start again with an empty log file, SA_LOG_FILE_FULL_ACTION_ROTATE) - Rotate the log (save this file as a previous version and start a new one)

class.name: MmasLogHandlerRoot
class.description: The class MmasLogHandleRoot Mo represents the main node for the MMAS log handle configuration. The supported logs are: - Audit Log - Server Log - Centralized Server Log - Trace Log

attribute.name: mmasLogHandlerRootId
attribute.description: This attribute defines the identity of the MmasLogHandlerRoot instance.

class.name: MmasLogHandlerFileConfig
class.description: The class MmasLogHandlerFileConfig is the node for file log stream configuration in MMAS.

attribute.name: mmasLogHandlerFileConfigId
attribute.description: This attribute defines the identity of the MmasLogHandlerFileConfig instance.

attribute.name: logHandlerLogFilePath
attribute.description: This attribute defines the location of the log file. For log streams this file path is relative to a system file path defined by the TSP/SAF layer. This path can specify any subdirectories relative to the system file path. For the local machine flat file log this is an absolute file path.

attribute.name: logHandlerMaxFileSize
attribute.description: This attribute defines the maximum size of an individual record in a log stream file. This allows a guaranteed number of log records within a file of a given maximum size.

attribute.name: logHandlerNumRotationFiles
attribute.description: This attribute defines the number of previous versions of log files, when logHandler-actionWhenFull is set to SA_LOG_FILE_FULL_ACTION_ROTATE. - Range 0 to 25.

class.name: MmasLoggerRoot
class.description: The class MmasLoggerRoot is the node for MMAS logging configuration.

attribute.name: mmasLoggerRootId
attribute.description: This attribute defines the identity of the MmasLoggerRoot instance.

class.name: MmasLoggerGroup
class.description: The class MmasLoggerGroup is the node for group MMAS logging configuration.

attribute.name: mmasLoggerGroupId
attribute.description: This attribute defines the identity of the MmasLoggerGroup instance.

attribute.name: logGroupName
attribute.description: This attribute defines a user-friendly name to refer to a group of loggers whose levels are to be collectively managed.

attribute.name: groupLoggerLevel
attribute.description: This attribute defines the level for a group of Java Logging loggers. This provides the level to be applied to each logger in the group, and any loggers beneath them in the hierarchy which do not have their own specific logging level. - Supported levels are: OFF, SEVERE, WARNING, INFO, CONFIG, FINE, FINER, FINEST, ALL.

attribute.name: loggerList
attribute.description: This attribute defines a list of one or more loggers which are to be treated collectively as members of a group.

class.name: MmasLogger
class.description: The class MmasLogger is the node for MMAS logging configuration.

attribute.name: mmasLoggerId
attribute.description: This attribute defines the identity of the MmasLogger instance.

attribute.name: loggerName
attribute.description: This attribute defines the fully dot-qualified name of the logger, giving its relationship in the logging hierarchy, for example, com.ericsson.mmas.common.AlarmSender.

attribute.name: loggerLevel
attribute.description: This attribute defines the level for the Java Logging logger. This provides a specific level for a logger - and any loggers beneath it in the hierarchy which do not have their own specific logging level. - Supported levels are: OFF, SEVERE, WARNING, INFO, CONFIG, FINE, FINER, FINEST, ALL.

class.name: MmasL4JLoggerGroup
class.description: The class MmasL4JLoggerGroup is the node for MMAS Log4J group logger configuration.

attribute.name: mmasL4JLoggerGroupId
attribute.description: This attribute defines the identity of the MmasL4JLoggerGroup instance.

attribute.name: logGroupName
attribute.description: This attribute defines a user-friendly name to refer to a group of loggers whose levels are to be collectively managed.

attribute.name: l4jGroupLoggerLevel
attribute.description: This attribute defines the level a group of Log4J loggers. This provides the level to be applied to each logger in the group - and any loggers beneath them in the hierarchy which do not have their own specific logging level. Log4J logging levels are managed in order to provide support for third-party applications that use the Log4J logging package. - Supported levels are: FATAL, ERROR, WARN, INFO, DEBUG, TRACE, ALL.

attribute.name: loggerList
attribute.description: This attribute defines a list of one or more loggers which are to be treated collectively as members of a group.

class.name: MmasL4JLogger
class.description: The class MmasL4JLogger is the node for MMAS Log4J logger configuration.

attribute.name: mmasL4JLoggerId
attribute.description: This attribute defines the identity of one MmasL4JLogger

attribute.name: loggerName
attribute.description: This attribute defines the fully dot-qualified name of the logger, giving its relationship in the logging hierarchy, for example, com.ericsson.mmas.common.AlarmSender.

attribute.name: l4jLoggerLevel
attribute.description: This attribute defines the level for the Log4J logger. This provides a specific level for a logger and any loggers beneath it in the hierarchy which do not have their own specific logging level. Log4J logging levels are managed in order to provide support for third-party applications that use the Log4J logging package. - Supported levels are: FATAL, ERROR, WARN, INFO, DEBUG, TRACE, ALL.

class.name: MmasDns
class.description: The class MmasDns stores and handles the Domain Name System (DNS) function in the MMAS.

attribute.name: mmasDnsId
attribute.description: This attribute defines the identity of the MmasDns instance.

attribute.name: dnsServerList
attribute.description: This attribute defines the servers which are available using DNS queries.

attribute.name: dnsCacheSize
attribute.description: This attribute defines the size of the cache for DNS queries.

attribute.name: dnsPingAttemtThreshold
attribute.description: This attribute defines the maximum number of ping attempts sent to DNS server, before the DNS server is considered to be unreachable.

attribute.name: dnsPingInterval
attribute.description: This attribute defines the time between pings, sent to the DNS server.

attribute.name: dnsPingQuery
attribute.description: This attribute defines the DNS entry which isused for DNS queries.

attribute.name: dnsOutgoingIP
attribute.description: This attribute defines the outgoing IP address for dnsjava requests from all nodes. If not set, the default routing (Linux) will be used.

class.name: MmasCountersHandler
class.description: The class MmasCountersHandler is the configuration node for a MMAS counters handler. It specifies a Java class responsible for updating one or more MMAS counters. This class is executed continuously after a defined period.

attribute.name: mmasCountersHandlerId
attribute.description: This attribute defines the identity of the MmasCountersHandler instance.

attribute.name: className
attribute.description: This attribute defines a Java class responsible for updating one or more MMAS counters. This class must implement the Runnable interface and must be available in the Common class loader.

attribute.name: period
attribute.description: This attribute defines the time in seconds between MMAS counter(s) updates. It defines how often the handler is called.

class.name: MmasCounters
class.description: The class MmasCounters is the configuration node for all MMAS counters. It includes, as childs, a list of handlers to populate the counters.

attribute.name: mmasCountersId
attribute.description: This attributes defines the key indentity of one MmasCounters

class.name: MmasCommon
class.description: The class MmasCommon is the node for general common MMAS configuration.

attribute.name: mmasCommonId
attribute.description: This attribute defines the identity of the MmasCommon instance.

attribute.name: adminHost
attribute.description: This attribute defines the identity of the MMAS administration host.

attribute.name: adminPort
attribute.description: This attribute defines the port number of the administrator port to use on the MMAS host.

attribute.name: oamPort
attribute.description: This attribute defines the port number of the oam port to use on the MMAS host.

attribute.name: adminUser
attribute.description: his attribute defines the user name to use when logging on the MMAS host as an administrator.

class.name: MmasAmf
class.description: The class MmasAmf is the node for availability management configuration in MMAS.

attribute.name: mmasAmfId
attribute.description: This attribute defines the identity of the MmasAmf instance.

attribute.name: threadPoolSize
attribute.description: This attribute defines the number of simultaneous operations that can be performed.

attribute.name: shutdownWhenDeactive
attribute.description: This attributes defines whether to shutdown the service when deactive, default set as false.

class.name: MmasAlarmTrigger
class.description: The class MmasAlarmTrigger is the monitoring threshold node for the MMAS.

attribute.name: mmasAlarmTriggerId
attribute.description: This attribute defines the identity of the MmasAlarmTrigger instance.

attribute.name: delay
attribute.description: This attribute defines the delay, after which the monitoring of resources starts again.

attribute.name: mmasId
attribute.description: key attribute

attribute.name: attrUint64
attribute.description: Mapped to BigInteger!

attribute.name: attrUint64Array
attribute.description: Mapped to BigInteger!

class.name: MmasDeployment
class.description: The class MmasDeployment is the node for Java EE application deployment in the MMAS.

attribute.name: mmasDeploymentId
attribute.description: This attribute defines the identity of the MmasDeployment instance.

attribute.name: pollInterval
attribute.description: This attribute defines how often the deployment directory is read to look for new, updated, or removed applications.

attribute.name: configDir
attribute.description: This attribute defines the path to the directory where Java EE applications archives are placed.

attribute.name: serverUrl
attribute.description: This attribute defines the URL of the admin server.
